candidates.title: Update dependencies and assess miri failures
Such rabbit hole like wow
candidates.body:
I found an issue where the benches weren't running due to a feature flag missing, then fell down a rather epic rabbit hole.

* adding more feature flag testing in CI
* various test things happen via make now so it can be run locally
* codespell fixin'
* markdown linting
* loads more test coverage
* clippy calming
* 🍰

candidates.title: fix BptreeMap doube free on remove
v5.2 - Resolve memory leak in arcache
candidates.body: If the write miss thread local cache was enabled, a mistake existed in the case where the write thread is under high pressure which could lead to memory being leaked. Nodes are now wrapped in a safe wrapper to ensure they can not be leaked.

candidates.title: Allow an inplace update to prevent a clone
Update to 0.5.0
candidates.body: version bump due to changes in async apis.

candidates.title: Remove mutual exclusion from the read side of all CowCell variants
candidates.body:
The read side basically needs an updatable `Arc` and there is a crate for that, `arc-swap`. And since we still have mutual exclusion for the write side, we do not even need a compare-and-swap/read-copy-update loop in the commit operation.

This is basically a continuation of #111 trying to lighten the read side further by avoiding mutual exclusion entirely. Furthermore, I noticed that I did not apply the same treatment to the publicly accessible `CowCell` which this PR also does. Finally, I think the fact that `EbrCell` basically already works like this internally lends some credibility to the approach.

candidates.title: RFC: Add optional Serde support for HashMap
candidates.body:
The implementation of `Deserialize` is based on the implementation of `Extend`.

I can of course remove the first commit as it is admittedly unrelated and unnecessary for Serde support, it just felt better working in a code base that starts without Clippy warnings and stays that way.

candidates.title: Bump ahash and lru dependencies to their current stable versions
Add get first/last to btree map
Disable thread cache by default, rename feature.
20221118 remove crossbeam scope
candidates.body: Remove crossbeam thread scope in favor of std, cleanup some deps to reduce build profile.

candidates.title: enable chonk nodes by default
candidates.body: This yields a significant improvement to performance of the hashtrie and arcache as a result.

candidates.title: 20220718 sptr miri
candidates.body:
Fixes #78 and Fixes #77 

Resolves UB in arcache, removes unsafe in threadcache, uses the sptr shim layer to allow pointer provenance.

candidates.title: Fixing linting, typo, adding testing
candidates.body:
* There was a typo of `repostiory` in Cargo.toml
* Clippy smiles on thee

candidates.title: Benchmarking
candidates.body: start work to improve arccache benches.

candidates.title: Add async hashmap example
candidates.body: Fixes #38 - this adds an example of an async capable hashmap, which minimises code reuse and can be help over await's.

candidates.title: Remove num
candidates.body: Fixes #58 removes num which is no longer used.
